text: Chionodes fuscomaculella, leaftier, Size: 7.7 mm Chionodes fuscomaculella is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Nova Scotia and Quebec to Florida, south-western Wisconsin, eastern Texas and eastern Oklahoma.Chionodes at funetmothphotographersgroup The forewings are dusted with brown, aggregated into irregular spots and blotches.Can. Ent. 4 (9): 170 The larvae feed on Quercus macrocarpa, Quercus rubra, Fagus grandifolia and Carya species. ==References== Category:Chionodes Category:Moths described in 1935 Category:Moths of North America
title: Chionodes fuscomaculella
